meanings.sent1: The smell of freshly baked cookies was irresistable to the children.
meanings.sent2: The cute puppy had an irresistable charm that melted everyone's heart.
meanings.sent3: The irresistable temptation of eating one more cookie was too strong to resist.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an irresistable magnet, drawing everyone towards her.
meanings.sent5: The allure of the shiny new toy was irresistable, making it hard to look away.

meanings.definition: Having an overpowering appeal or attraction.
meanings.sent1: The movie had an irresistable plot that kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent2: The singer's voice was so irresistable that the crowd couldn't stop cheering.
meanings.sent3: The irresistable aroma of the freshly brewed coffee filled the room.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with irresistable colors, creating a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The irresistable beauty of the garden left visitors in awe of its splendor.
